short_bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is a renowned Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He has hosted several cookery shows and is the author of numerous best-selling cookbooks.

ingredients: 1 kg boneless chicken, cut into pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a bowl, mix the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Marinate the chicken in this mixture for 2-3 hours.
2. Heat the oil and butter in a pan. Add the marinated chicken and cook until it is browned on all sides.
3. Add water and garam masala powder, cover and cook until the chicken is tender.
4. Add kasoori methi and simmer for 5 minutes.
5. Serve hot with naan or rice.

1. Heat the oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add the onions, ginger paste, garlic paste, and sauté until the onions are soft.
3. Add the tomatoes and cook until they are soft and mushy.
4. Add the spinach and cook until it wilts.
5. Add the paneer, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
6. Serve hot with roti or rice.

1. Pressure cook the soaked kidney beans with water and salt until they are soft.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
3. Add chopped onion and sauté until they turn translucent.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
5. Add chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Cook until the tomatoes are mushy.
6. Add the cooked kidney beans, salt, and water. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
7. Serve hot with cooked rice.

short_bio: Vikas Khanna is an award-winning Indian chef, restaurateur, and cookbook writer. He has been honored with several prestigious awards, including the Michelin Star, and has authored numerous cookbooks.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a bowl, mix the chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
2. Melt the butter in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the tomato puree and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Reduce the heat to low and add the heavy cream. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
5. Serve hot with rice or naan.

1. Wash and chop the spinach. Set aside.
2. Melt the butter in a pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the onions are translucent.
3. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a minute.
4. Add the chopped spinach and cook until it wilts, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the paneer cubes and mix gently. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.

1. In a bowl, mix the yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, cayenne pepper, lemon juice, and salt.
2. Add the chicken to the bowl and coat well with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top.
4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place it on the wire rack. Discard any excess marinade.
5. Bake the chicken for 25-30 minutes or until cooked through, turning once halfway through.
6. If you want the chicken to have a charred look, turn on the broiler for the last 2-3 minutes of cooking.
7. Serve hot with a side of naan or rice.

short_bio: Tarla Dalal was an Indian cookbook author and chef. She wrote over 100 cookbooks and hosted several cooking shows. Her recipes are popular among the Indian diaspora worldwide.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
2. Add chopped onions and green chillies, and saute until onions turn golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for 1 minute.
4. Add chopped spinach, turmeric powder, and salt. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add cubed paneer, garam masala, and cream. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Serve hot with naan or rice.

For chole:
1. Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook for 6-7 whistles.
2. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped onions and green chillies, and saute until onions turn golden brown.
4. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
5. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
7. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

For bhature:
1. Mix flour, yogurt, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
2. Knead a soft dough using water.
3. Cover and rest for 1-2 hours.
4. Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into circles.
5. Heat oil in a pan and fry the bhature until they turn golden brown.
6. Serve hot with chole.

1. Make slits on the chicken legs and keep aside.
2. In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, lemon juice, and salt.
3. Marinate the chicken legs in the mixture and refrigerate for 2-3 hours or overnight.
4. Preheat the oven to 200°C.
5. Place the chicken legs on a baking tray lined with foil.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Serve hot with mint chutney.

short_bio: Madhur Jaffrey is an Indian-born actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She has authored several cookbooks and is known for her contributions to popularizing Indian cuisine in the West.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, salt, ginger, and cinnamon. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.

Preheat the broiler. Thread the chicken onto skewers and discard the marinade. Broil the chicken for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.

In a large skillet, heat the tomato sauce over medium heat. Add the cooked chicken and heavy cream and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened. Stir in the cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

Wash the spinach and blanch it in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and puree in a blender or food processor.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the ginger and garlic pastes and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.

Add the spinach puree and salt to taste. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened. Stir in the heavy cream and crumbled paneer and cook for another 5-10 minutes, until the paneer is heated through. Serve with rice or naan.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder. In a separate bowl, mix together the warm milk, yogurt, egg, and vegetable oil. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until the dough comes together.

Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for 5-10 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a towel, and let it rest in a warm place for 1-2 hours, until it doubles in size.

Preheat the oven to 500°F (260°C) and place a baking stone or sheet pan in the oven to preheat. Divide the dough into 8-10 equal pieces and roll each piece into a teardrop shape.

Place the naan on the preheated baking stone or sheet pan and bake for 3-4 minutes, until it puffs up and the bottom is golden brown. Flip the naan over and bake for another 2-3 minutes, until the other side is golden brown as well.

Brush the hot naan with melted butter and serve warm.

short_bio: Shipra Khanna is an Indian-born Michelin-starred chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants and has authored several cookbooks.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger, garlic, turmeric, garam masala, coriander, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt.
2. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat.
3. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
4. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken and any remaining marinade to the skillet and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
6. Add the diced tomatoes and heavy cream to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.
8. Serve the butter chicken hot, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired.

ingredients: 2 lbs fresh spinach, stemmed and washed
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large skillet, heat the ghee over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the ginger, garlic, turmeric, garam masala, coriander, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. Add the spinach to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted, about 5 minutes.
5. Transfer the spinach mixture to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
6. Return the spinach mixture to the skillet and stir in the heavy cream.
7. Add the paneer cubes to the skillet and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
8. Garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired, and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, cumin, and salt.
2. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat.
3. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.
4. In a large skillet, heat the ghee over medium-high heat.
5. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the garlic and ginger to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
7. Add the marinated chicken to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
8. Add the tomato puree to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
9. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
10. Stir in the heavy cream and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
11. Garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired, and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

short_bio: Ranveer Brar is an Indian celebrity chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has hosted several cooking shows and is known for his modern take on traditional Indian cuisine.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken, cut into bite-size pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Marinate the chicken in yogurt, ginger garlic paste, and salt for at least 1 hour. 
2. Heat butter in a pan and add the marinated chicken. Cook until browned. 
3. Add the cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add the tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes. 
5. Add the cream and cook for another 5-7 minutes. 
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.

1. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 
2. Add the onion and ginger garlic paste. Cook until the onion is translucent. 
3. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. 
5. Blend the mixture to a smooth paste. 
6. Return the mixture to the pan and add the paneer. Cook for 5-7 minutes. 
7. Add the cream and cook for another 2-3 minutes. 
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken, cut into bite-size pieces
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Marinate the chicken in yogurt, ginger garlic paste, and salt for at least 1 hour. 
2. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 
3. Thread the chicken onto skewers and bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes. 
4. In a separate pan, heat butter and add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and chili powder. Cook for 2-3 minutes. 
5. Add the tomato puree and cook for 5-7 minutes. 
6. Add the cream and cook for another 2-3 minutes. 
7. Add the cooked chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes. 
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.
